column4: no more free CD's of ubuntu. :( Really not a problem with my 6 mbit dsl, but it IS easier to convert people with a branded cd than a home-burned one.
I know. :) but I won't. I'm not working with linux any more, so my level of missionary work has dropped drastically.
erm.. I only have command line access to the system
Ah, well now, that's a different matter altogether...
do you know about lynx, and centericq?
those are excellent browser and IM programs for the command-line
just need to know the name of the layout
my problem was in the nx client. I had to set the keyboard layout in the nx client.
and then I managed to get xfce running too. :)
